pageContext.description: Edges blunt. Hilt verging on spatulate with rounded heel. 1 rivet broken out in antiquity: one survives, L 12mm, W at head 5mm & 5.3mm, ends rounded.On reverse are white and pale green patches (?dust of cremated bones). No trace of burial.
pageContext.patina: Dark olive green patina on one face, dull blue-green on that drawn; partially worn to dark purple-brown core.
pageContext.surface: Worn and [?crazed] by burning, lustrous. Break apparently ancient.
pageContext.other: Width: hilt 27.5mm; at break 12mm,Weight: just over 3/4 oz. = 21.26gms
pageContext.publications: L.F. Chitty, Shropshire Arch. Trans., 1938, Misc. i-ii, Fig.
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum,Donor, Wm. Scotson, finder.,1938,Drawn by Lily F. Chitty, 10 February 1937
pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Church Stretton,Caradoc Hill,About 200 yards W.S.W. of entrance to hill-fort in a rock crevice.,1936
pageContext.toSearch: Caer Caradoc Hill, Church Stretton, Shropshire Sy6, UK
pageContext.remarks: Salop S & S Record, no. 240.,CI; SI
